name: Yallaiah Onteru
title: Java AWS Cloud Engineer
professional_summary: Utilized Java and Spring Boot to develop microservices for an insurance claims processing system, reducing claim settlement time by 30%.
Implemented AWS Lambda functions to automate policy document generation, improving efficiency by 40%.
Integrated AWS S3 and DynamoDB for scalable data storage in a healthcare analytics platform, ensuring HIPAA compliance.
Developed RESTful APIs using Java and Spring for a banking transaction system, enhancing transaction speed by 25%.
Used AWS EC2 and RDS to deploy a fraud detection system for a fintech client, achieving 95% accuracy.
Applied Java and Hibernate to build a customer relationship management (CRM) system for a consulting firm, improving client retention by 20%.
Implemented AWS CloudWatch for monitoring and logging in a real-time insurance claims dashboard, reducing downtime by 35%.
Developed a Java-based batch processing system using AWS Batch for healthcare data normalization, ensuring GDPR compliance.
Integrated AWS SNS and SQS for event-driven architecture in a banking notification system, improving message delivery reliability by 45%.
Used Java and AWS Step Functions to orchestrate a multi-step insurance policy approval workflow, reducing approval time by 50%.
Implemented AWS IAM roles and policies to secure access to healthcare data lakes, ensuring PHI protection.
Developed a Java-based ETL pipeline using AWS Glue for banking data migration, reducing migration time by 60%.
Utilized AWS CloudFormation to automate infrastructure provisioning for an insurance application, improving deployment speed by 70%.
Implemented Java and AWS Kinesis for real-time fraud detection in a banking system, reducing fraudulent transactions by 80%.
Developed a Java-based API gateway using AWS API Gateway for a healthcare platform, improving API security and performance.
Integrated AWS CodePipeline and CodeBuild for CI/CD in a fintech application, reducing deployment errors by 90%.
Used Java and AWS ElasticSearch to build a search functionality for an insurance policy database, improving search speed by 50%.
Implemented AWS S3 lifecycle policies for data archiving in a healthcare analytics system, reducing storage costs by 40%.

Cloud Platforms: AWS (EC2, S3, Lambda, RDS, CloudWatch, DynamoDB, SNS, SQS, Step Functions, IAM, Glue, CloudFormation, Kinesis, API Gateway, CodePipeline, CodeBuild, ElasticSearch)
